intro: Verbascum josgadense, commonly known as the Josgaden mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its fuzzy, woolly leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. It is known for its medicinal properties, with historical use in treating respiratory ailments. The plant's structure and growth habits make it well adapted to arid environments.
